event.name: AbusiveExperienceHeuristic
event.summary: Various metrics recording experiences which are commonly used for abusive purposes.

metric.name: DidTabUnder
metric.summary: True if the page attempted a tab-under navigation.

metric.name: UploadDecision
metric.summary: Whether the upload was proposed to the user or the reasons why it was not. The value is a bitmask of |CardUploadDecisionMetric|.

event.name: Autofill.DeveloperEngagement
event.summary: Recorded when we parse a form to log whether developer has used autocomplete markup or UPI-VPA hints. The value is a bitmask of |DeveloperEngagementMetric|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form. This is the hash identifier used to denote this form for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms. See |FormStructure::IsCompleteCreditCardForm()|.

event.name: Autofill.FieldFillStatus
event.summary: Recorded when Chrome validates field type predictions (on submit, on leaving a form, on receiving a form with autocomplete attributes).

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field. This is the hash identifier used to denote this field for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form. This is the hash identifier used to denote this form for query and voting purposes. See components/autofill/core/common/signatures_util.cc for more details.

metric.name: IsAutofilled
metric.summary: The field is currently autofilled.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: PredictionSource
metric.summary: The system which generated the prediction: heuristics, server, overall.

metric.name: ValidationEvent
metric.summary: The event which triggered the validation: Submission, Left Form, Form has Autocomplete attributes.

metric.name: WasPreviouslyAutofilled
metric.summary: The field was autofilled and subsequently edited.

event.name: Autofill.FieldTypeValidation
event.summary: Recorded when Chrome validates field type predictions (on submit, on leaving a form, on receiving a form with autocomplete attributes).

metric.name: ActualType
metric.summary: The observed type of the field. See: autofill::ServerFieldType

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: PredictedType
metric.summary: The predicted type of the field. See: autofill::ServerFieldType

metric.name: PredictionSource
metric.summary: The system which generated the prediction: heuristics, server, overall.

metric.name: ValidationEvent
metric.summary: The event which triggered the validation: Submission, Left Form, Form has Autocomplete attributes.

event.name: Autofill.FormSubmitted
event.summary: Recorded when user submits a form.

metric.name: AutofillFormSubmittedState
metric.summary: Whether form's fields were all autofilled, some fields were autofilled, or none of the field were autofilled. See |AutofillFormSubmittedState|.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: FormSignature is approximately 10 bit hash of form structure.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms. See |FormStructure::IsCompleteCreditCardForm()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

event.name: Autofill.InteractedWithForm
event.summary: Recorded when we parse a form to log form metadata and autofill settings that apply to all subsequent events for this form.

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: FormSignature is approximately 10 bit hash of form structure.

metric.name: FormTypes
metric.summary: Type of form. Stored as bitvector. A set ith bit implies enum FormType's ith type was detected. Multiple types are possible.

metric.name: IsForCreditCard
metric.summary: True for credit card forms, false for address/profile forms.

metric.name: LocalRecordTypeCount
metric.summary: Number of local credit cards or local autofill profiles.

metric.name: ServerRecordTypeCount
metric.summary: Number of masked and full server credit cards or server autofill profiles.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

event.name: Autofill.SuggestionFilled
event.summary: Recorded when user selects a suggestion and we fill the form with that suggestion.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: RecordType
metric.summary: Whether the suggestion was from a local card/autofill profile or from a server card/autofill profile.

event.name: Autofill.SuggestionsShown
event.summary: Recorded when a suggestion is shown to user.

metric.name: FieldSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the field

metric.name: FormSignature
metric.summary: The signature of the form.

metric.name: HeuristicType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| based on heuristics. See |AutofillField.heuristic_type()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldType
metric.summary: Field's autocomplete field type hint. See |AutofillField.html_type()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: ServerType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| returned by server. See |AutofillField.server_type()|.

event.name: Autofill.TextFieldDidChange
event.summary: Recorded when user edits a text field. The text field may have been autofilled.

metric.name: FieldTypeGroup
metric.summary: Field's |FieldTypeGroup|. See |AutofillType.group()|.

metric.name: HeuristicType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| based on heuristics. See |AutofillField.heuristic_type()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldMode
metric.summary: Whether the field's autocomplete hint specified 'billing' or 'shipping'. See |AutofillField.html_mode()|.

metric.name: HtmlFieldType
metric.summary: Field's autocomplete field type hint. See |AutofillField.html_type()|.

metric.name: IsAutofilled
metric.summary: True if the field was autofilled. See |AutofillField.is_autofilled|.

metric.name: IsEmpty
metric.summary: True if the field was empty. See |AutofillField.IsEmpty()|.

metric.name: MillisecondsSinceFormParsed
metric.summary: Time since form parse.

metric.name: ServerType
metric.summary: Field's |ServerFieldType| returned by server. See |AutofillField.server_type()|.

event.name: Blink.UpdateTime
event.summary: Metrics that measure various update times in Blink. This includes paint, compositing, and layout update times. The metrics are recorded once per second and at the destruction of the local frame root.

metric.name: Compositing.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the compositing phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Compositing.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the compositing phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: IntersectionObservation.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken to compute IntersectionObserver observations in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: IntersectionObservation.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by to compute IntersectionObserver observations in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Paint.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: Paint.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: PrePaint.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the pre-paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: PrePaint.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the pre-paint phase in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout.Average
metric.summary: The average time taken by the style and layout phases in microseconds in the event period.

metric.name: StyleAndLayout.WorstCase
metric.summary: The longest single time taken by the style and layout phases in microseconds in the event period.

event.name: Blink.UseCounter
event.summary: Collects data for a subset of UseCounter features. When UMA UseCounter data shows a behaviour that is rare but too common to blindly change. This metric should be used to reason about whether a breaking change is acceptable or not.

metric.name: Feature
metric.summary: Opt-in UseCounter feature.

event.name: Compositor.UserInteraction
event.summary: Metrics related to user interaction handled by the compositor. This includes user gestures like scrolling, pinch-zoom and page-scale animations triggered in response to a double-tap event. The length of the user interaction is defined as the time the compositor is running an animation resulting from user input.

metric.name: CheckerboardedContentArea
metric.summary: The number of visible pixels per frame checkerboarded during this interaction.

metric.name: CheckerboardedContentAreaRatio
metric.summary: The percentage of visible pixels per frame checkerboarded during this interaction. This value should be between [0, 100].

metric.name: CheckerboardedImagesCount
metric.summary: The number of images checker-imaged and re-rasterized during this interaction.

metric.name: NumMissingTiles
metric.summary: The number of visible tiles per frame checkerboarded during this interaction.

event.name: Compositor.Rendering
event.summary: Metrics related to rendering in the compositor.

metric.name: CheckerboardedImagesCount
metric.summary: The number of images checker-imaged and re-rasterized on this page.

event.name: ContextualSearch
event.summary: Metrics related to a Contextual Search Tap event on a page, for use with Ranker. These metrics are recorded each time the user triggers the Contextual Search UI via a tap gesture (when enabled).

metric.name: DidOptIn
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user has Opted-in to the privacy conditions for Contextual Search or not.

metric.name: DurationAfterScrollMs
metric.summary: Duration in MS between showing the UI and a subsequent scroll event, or not recorded if there was no subsequent scroll.

metric.name: FontSize
metric.summary: Emits a value from 0-10 representing the effective font size on the screen. A value of 0 means the font size cannot be obtained. A value of 1 represents a very small font and a value of 10 represents a large font.

metric.name: IsEntity
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the word tapped appears to be part of an entity, given simple English language rules that check capitalization and punctuation.

metric.name: IsEntityEligible
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the IsEntity boolean ever had a chance of being true or not. When we're dealing with languages other than ones where our simple entity-detection can work this signal is false.

metric.name: IsHttp
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the base page is HTTP (insecure).

metric.name: IsLanguageMismatch
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the language of the base page is a mismatch from the list of languages the user knows, so they might want translation.

metric.name: IsLongWord
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the word tapped was considered long (at least 10 chars in length).

metric.name: IsSecondTapOverride
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the tap was an override of normal tap suppression because it was considered a second tap on a word after the first tap was suppressed.

metric.name: IsShortWord
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the word tapped was considered short (less than 4 characters in length).

metric.name: IsWordEdge
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the tap gesture was on the edge of a word, rather than in the middle 50% of the word.

metric.name: OutcomeRankerDidPredict
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether Ranker was able to make a prediction.

metric.name: OutcomeRankerPrediction
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate what Ranker's prediction was for this record.

metric.name: OutcomeWasCardsDataShown
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether any Contextual Cards data was shown in the Contextual Search Bar.

metric.name: OutcomeWasPanelOpened
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user opened the overlay panel. This is the primary outcome metric.

metric.name: OutcomeWasQuickActionClicked
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user clicked within the overlay panel when a Quick-Action was shown. This is a secondary outcome metric.

metric.name: OutcomeWasQuickAnswerSeen
metric.summary: Emits a 1 or 0 to indicate whether the user could see a Quick-Answer caption within the overlay panel. This is a tertiary outcome metric.

metric.name: PortionOfElement
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-10 inclusive that expresses the portion of the enclosing element that is the word tapped. A zero will be emitted if the ratio cannot be calculated. A value of 10 means the word spans the entire element, and a value of 1 means the word is 10% or less than the entire element.

metric.name: Previous28DayCtrPercent
metric.summary: The CTR of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated over a previous 28 day period, expressed as an integer between 0-99.

metric.name: Previous28DayImpressionsCount
metric.summary: The count of views of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated over a previous 28 day period.

metric.name: PreviousWeekCtrPercent
metric.summary: The CTR of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated over the previous week, expressed as an integer between 0-99.

metric.name: PreviousWeekImpressionsCount
metric.summary: The count of views of the overlay panel for this user, aggregated over the previous week.

metric.name: ScreenTopDps
metric.summary: The location of the tap relative to the top of the screen, expressed in DPs.

metric.name: TapDurationMs
metric.summary: The duration of the tap gesture expressed as an integer in milliseconds.

metric.name: WasScreenBottom
metric.summary: The location of the tap relative to the bottom of the screen, expressed as an integer with 0 meaning not at the bottom and 1 meaning at the bottom.

event.name: ContextualSuggestions
event.summary: Metrics related to Contextual Suggestions shown in the Chrome Assistive Surface, aka EoC shown in CAS. These metrics are recorded each time the Contextual Suggestions UI is dismissed. Each record always contains a value for every metric known at the time of the implementation.

metric.name: AnyDownloaded
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the user downloaded any suggestions.

metric.name: AnySuggestionTaken
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether any suggestion link was taken.

metric.name: ClosedFromPeek
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the peeking sheet was closed by tapping on the close button.

metric.name: EverOpened
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the sheet was ever opened.

metric.name: FetchState
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-7 to indicate the ending state of the data fetcher and results returned. A value of 0 indicates not-started, a 7 indicates fetch-completed with suggestions. See the code for details.

metric.name: ShowDurationBucketMin
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-N to indicate the duration that the sheet was shown before a positive or negative action was taken. A value of 0 indicates that the UI was never shown. A value greater than 0 indicates that some user interaction occurred taking at least the indicated number of milliseconds, but less than twice that amount. This exponential bucketing is done for privacy reasons, and uses the UKM GetExponentialBucketMin method with a value of 2.0 for spacing.

metric.name: TriggerEvent
metric.summary: Emits an integer in the range 0-1 to indicate whether the peeking sheet was ever triggered and how it was triggered. A value of 0 indicates never-shown, a 1 indicates peeked in response to a reverse-scroll (the only trigger currently supported).

event.name: CPUUsageMeasurement
event.summary: A CPU usage measurement that corresponds to a tick in a CPU usage time-series. There is also some metadata stored to determine how faithful the CPU usage measurement is (e.g. NumberOfCoresidentTabs).

metric.name: CPUUsage
metric.summary: CPU usage measurement. This is in units of clock-cycles. For example, 1.2 seconds of 100% CPU usage on a 2.5GHz CPU corresponds to a value of 1.2 x 1.0 x 2.5e9 = 3e6.

metric.name: EventType
metric.summary: The event associated with the measurement. This is an integer value corresponding to the enum defined in resource_coordinator::RenderProcessProbe.

metric.name: IsVisible
metric.summary: Indicates if any frame hosted in this tab is visible at the moment the measurement is taken.

metric.name: NumberOfCoresidentTabs
metric.summary: Number of co-resident tabs in all of the render processes a tab is associated with when the CPU usage measurement is taken.

metric.name: ObservationWindowSizeMs
metric.summary: The size of the observation window (time since last CPU measurement) in milliseconds.

metric.name: ProcessUptimeMs
metric.summary: The uptime of the process being measured, in milliseconds.

event.name: DocumentCreated
event.summary: Recorded when a Document object is created and records the source ID of the navigation and whether the document was in the main frame. This can be used to link subframe UKM events to the parent document.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Whether the document was in the main frame. This is can either be 0 or 1.

metric.name: NavigationSourceId
metric.summary: Contains the UKM source id of the navigation as an integer.

event.name: Document.OutliveTimeAfterShutdown
event.summary: Recorded when a Document object survives certain number of garbage collections after detached. It is expected that regular Document objects are destroyed soon after detached, and if a document outlives longer, probably this can be leaked.

metric.name: GCCount
metric.summary: Measures the numbers of garbarge collection after the document is detached. This is recorded when the number reached certain numbers like 5 or 10.

event.name: Download.Started
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download begins. It has one Download.Ended and none to multiple Download.Interrupted/Download.Resumed events associated with it.

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: DownloadSource
metric.summary: The source of the download, expressed as an enum defined in DownloadEntry.

metric.name: FileType
metric.summary: The type of file that is downloaded, expressed as an enum defined in DownloadContentType.

event.name: Download.Completed
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download completes. Its parent event is Download.Started.

metric.name: BytesWasted
metric.summary: The number of bytes that have been used in an excess (ie. download restarting the middle of a download).

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: ResultingFileSize
metric.summary: The size of the file that is downloaded, expressed in kilobytes with exponentially growing buckets.

metric.name: TimeSinceStart
metric.summary: The difference in the time between when the download finished and when it began, expressed in miliseconds.

event.name: Download.Interrupted
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download is interrupted. Its parent event is Download.Started.

metric.name: BytesWasted
metric.summary: The number of bytes that have been used in an excess (ie. download restarting the middle of a download).

metric.name: ChangeInFileSize
metric.summary: The difference in the size of the file that is downloaded compared to the initial reported size, expressed in kilobytes with exponentially growing buckets.

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: Reason
metric.summary: The reason the download was interrupted, expressed as an enum defined in DownloadInterruptReason.

metric.name: ResultingFileSize
metric.summary: The size of the file that is downloaded, expressed in kilobytes with exponentially growing buckets.

metric.name: TimeSinceStart
metric.summary: The difference in the time between when the download interrupted and when it began, expressed in miliseconds.

event.name: Download.Resumed
event.summary: Metrics taken when a download is resumed. Its parent event is Download.Started.

metric.name: DownloadId
metric.summary: The id of the download that is used to associate separate events.

metric.name: Mode
metric.summary: The mode by which the download was resumed, expressed as an enum defined in ResumeMode.

metric.name: TimeSinceStart
metric.summary: The difference in the time between when the download resumed and when it began, expressed in miliseconds.

event.name: Event.ScrollUpdate.Touch
event.summary: Metrics related to a scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a touch event and the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between the initial creation of a touch event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made. The first GSU of every scrolling sequence is excluded from this metric.

event.name: Event.ScrollBegin.Touch
event.summary: Metrics related to first scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a touch event and the first generated ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a touch event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event if that ScrollUpdate is the first such event in a given scroll gesture event sequence. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made.

event.name: Event.ScrollUpdate.Wheel
event.summary: Metrics related to a scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a wheel event and the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollUpdate gesture event, no recording is made. The first GSU of every scrolling sequence is excluded from this metric.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between the initial creation of a wheel event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made. The first GSU of every scrolling sequence is excluded from this metric.

event.name: Event.ScrollBegin.Wheel
event.summary: Metrics related to first scroll action caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event.

metric.name: IsMainThread
metric.summary: Whether the event is handled on the main thread or not.

metric.name: TimeToHandled
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between initial creation of a wheel event and the first generated ScrollUpdate gesture event in a given scroll gesture event sequence is handled on main/impl thread. If no swap was induced by the ScrollBegin gesture event, no recording is made.

metric.name: TimeToScrollUpdateSwapBegin
metric.summary: The time in microseconds between the initial creation of a wheel event and the start of the frame swap on the GPU service caused by the generated ScrollUpdate gesture event if that ScrollUpdate is the first such event in a given scroll gesture event sequence. If no swap was induced by the event, no recording is made.

event.name: Intervention.DocumentWrite.ScriptBlock
event.summary: Recorded for page loads where the document.write script block intervention could apply.

metric.name: Disabled.Reload
metric.summary: Records '1' if the document.write script block intervention could have applied, but was disabled due to the page being reloaded.

metric.name: ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptExecutionFromDocumentWrite
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds that the HTML parser spent blocked on the execution of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

metric.name: ParseTiming.ParseBlockedOnScriptLoadFromDocumentWrite
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds that the HTML parser spent blocked on the load of scripts inserted from document.write, for main frame documents that finished parsing.

event.name: LocalNetworkRequests
event.summary: Metrics that describe the resource request behavior of pages for which navigation successfully commits. A separate entry is generated for every unique IP address or localhost port number to which the loaded page makes a resource request.

metric.name: Count.Failed
metric.summary: The count of requests made by the page to the given resource for which a response is not received or a network error occurs (i.e. |net_error| != |net::OK|) between the time navigation to the page commits and the time it completes.

metric.name: Count.Successful
metric.summary: The count of requests made by the page to the given resource for which a successful response is received (i.e. |net_error| == |net::OK|) between the time navigation to the page commits and the time it completes.

metric.name: PortType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of port for requests to localhost. The enum is defined in |LocalNetworkRequestsPageLoadMetricsObserver|. Possible values are 1 for common web server ports, 2 for common database server ports, 4 for common print server ports, 8 for common development server ports, and 0 for all other ports.

metric.name: ResourceType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of resource requested. The enum is defined in |LocalNetworkRequestsPageLoadMetricsObserver|. Possible values are 0 for public resources requested by private pages, 1 for private resources requested by public pages, 2 for private resources within the same reserved IP space as the loaded private page, 4 for for private resources within a different reserved IP space than the loaded private page, 8 for resources requested by public pages that are suspected to be routers, and 16 for localhost resources.

event.name: Media.Autoplay.Attempt
event.summary: Event recorded when there is an attempt to autoplay (ie. no user gesture). It will be recorded regardless of the result of this attempt.

metric.name: AudioTrack
metric.summary: Whether the element had an audio track when autoplay was attempted.

metric.name: HighMediaEngagement
metric.summary: Whether the document has a high media engagement.

metric.name: Muted
metric.summary: Whether the element was muted when autoplay was attempted.

metric.name: Source
metric.summary: Source of the autoplay attempt: 0 for attribute; 1 for play().

metric.name: UserGestureRequired
metric.summary: Whether a user gesture was required per autoplay rules at the time of attempt. By definition there is no user gesture on the stack when the attempt is registered.

metric.name: UserGestureStatus
metric.summary: Reflects the current status of user gesture/activation. This is a bit field with the following values: - 0b0001 if there is a user gesture on the stack; - 0b0010 if there was a user gesture on the page (ie. was activated); - 0b0100 if there was a user gesture propogated after a navigation.

metric.name: VideoTrack
metric.summary: Whether the element had a video track when autoplay was attempted.

event.name: Media.Autoplay.Muted.UnmuteAction
event.summary: Event recorded when there is an attempt to unmute an media that was autoplaying following the rules of autoplay muted.

metric.name: Result
metric.summary: 0 means that the unmute failed because it happened without a user gesture. 1 means that it succeeded because it had a user gesture.

metric.name: Source
metric.summary: Similar to "Source" in "Media.Autoplay.Attempt" with the addition of a value for both sources being used: 0 for attribute; 1 for play(); 2 for both attempted.

event.name: Media.Engagement.ShortPlaybackIgnored
event.summary:
The Media Engagement index stores the number of significant media playbacks per origin and the number of audible players. From that we calculate a Media Engagement Score.
Media with a short playback length is ignored so we are logging any time the player is ignored with the length in msec. This will allow us to identify whether sites are being penalized or there is abuse and allow us to tweak the length considered "short".

event.name: Media.Engagement.SessionFinished
event.summary:
The Media Engagement index stores the number of significant media playbacks per origin and the number of visits. From that we calculate a Media Engagement Score.
To tweak the scoring function we are logging the total number of significant media playbacks, the total number of visits, the calculated engagement score and the new number of significant media playbacks that occured this visit.

metric.name: Engagement.IsHigh
metric.summary: Whether the Media Engagement Service considers the score to be high (we are using a two threshold approach so there is one threshold to be considered high and another one to lose that status to reduce jitter).

metric.name: Engagement.IsHigh.Changed
metric.summary: Whether the IsHigh bit changed during the current session.

metric.name: Engagement.IsHigh.Changes
metric.summary: Counts of IsHigh changing (from 0 to 1 or 1 to 0).

metric.name: Engagement.IsPreloaded
metric.summary: Whether the origin was preloaded (from the chrome://component) as a high engagement origin.

metric.name: Engagement.Score
metric.summary: The calculated Media Engagement score for the current origin. The score is calculated by dividing the number of significant media playbacks by the number of visits. If the number of visits is below 5 then the score will be zero. This score is taken from MediaEngagementService.

metric.name: Playbacks.Delta
metric.summary: The number of significant media playbacks on this origin during this session (a visit to an origin on the same tab). A playback is determined significant if it meets certain criteria such as a video size of at least 200x140px, is not muted, is playing, etc.

metric.name: Playbacks.SecondsSinceLast
metric.summary: The number of seconds between significant media playback on the last visit and significant media playback on the current visit. If there was no previous visit or significant media playback this visit it will be 0.

metric.name: Playbacks.Total
metric.summary: The total number of significant media playbacks on this origin.

metric.name: Player.Audible.Delta
metric.summary: The number of unique audio/video players on a page that was audible (made sound) during a visit.

metric.name: Player.Audible.Total
metric.summary: The delta from above but instead of a single visit, the total of all deltas for all visits on this origin.

metric.name: Player.Significant.Delta
metric.summary: The number of unique audio/video players on a page that was audible (made sound) and considered significant (played for at least 7 seconds) during a visit.

metric.name: Player.Significant.Total
metric.summary: The delta from above but instead of a single visit, the total of all deltas for all visits on this origin.

metric.name: Visits.Total
metric.summary: The total number of visits to this origin.

event.name: Media.SiteMuted
event.summary: Event recorded when a website tries to play audio but is muted by the sound content setting.

metric.name: MuteReason
metric.summary: Enum value giving the reason the site was muted. Defined as |SoundContentSettingObserver::MuteReason|.

event.name: Media.WatchTime
event.summary:
Watch time is defined as the amount of elapsed media time for audio+video media aggregated per player instance. A minimum of 7 seconds of unmuted, foreground media must be watched to start watch time monitoring. Watch time is checked on a regular basis and reported upon one of the stop events mentioned below or at player destruction if none occur prior.
Any one of paused, hidden, or muted is sufficient to stop watch time metric reports. Each of these has a hysteresis where if the state change is undone within some time, the watch time will be counted as uninterrupted.
Power events (on/off battery power) have a similar hysteresis, but unlike the aforementioned properties, will not stop metric collection.
Native controls events have a similar behavior than power events.
Each seek event will result in a new watch time metric being started and the old metric finalized as accurately as possible.

event.name: Media.WebMediaPlayerState
event.summary: Final state of WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. Records only immutable playback properties. Contains a PlaybackID which links to Media.BasicPlayback events.

metric.name: FinalPipelineStatus
metric.summary: media::PipelineStatus enum value. Always 0 if the playback succeeded; all other values indicate the playback ended in an error.

metric.name: IsEME
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an EME playback. Note: EME can be attached anytime during the lifecycle of a WebMediaPlayerImpl, but once attached can't be removed.

metric.name: IsMSE
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an MSE playback. If false it means this was a SRC playback.

metric.name: IsTopFrame
metric.summary: Flag indicating whether the report comes from the top frame or some inner frame. For privacy, metrics from inner frames are recorded with the top frame's origin, so this flag helps separate top frame vs. embedded playbacks.

metric.name: PlayerID
metric.summary: ID which corresponds to a given WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. May be linked with Media.BasicPlayback events to understand a playback more deeply.

metric.name: TimeToFirstFrame
metric.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until the first video frame has been shown.

metric.name: TimeToMetadata
metric.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until metadata is known.

metric.name: TimeToPlayReady
metric.summary: Time in milliseconds from when WebMediaPlayerImpl starts loading until it has buffered enough to start playback.

event.name: Media.BasicPlayback
event.summary: Core metrics associated with a media playback through WebMediaPlayerImpl. Reported at the time of WatchTimeRecorder destruction or render process termination; whichever comes first. There will be multiple entries for a given playback; one for every PlaybackProperties change as well as one for foreground and background. Records may be aggregated based on PlayerID and correlated with the Media.WebMediaPlayerState event.

metric.name: AudioCodec
metric.summary: media::AudioCodec enum value. Can be kUnknownAudioCodec even with HasAudio is true because we don't always know the codec.

metric.name: AudioDecoderName
metric.summary: Enumeration of audio decoder names, zero if none or unknown (Cast, HLS, etc). See WatchTimeRecorder::AudioDecoderName enum for expected values.

metric.name: AutoplayInitiated
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating whether the initial playback was initiated via autoplay. Multilpe chunk records of the same player should have the same value. Autoplay is defined as a playback starting before there was a user activation on the page or without a user initiated same-domain navigation.

metric.name: HasAudio
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating the presence of audio.

metric.name: HasVideo
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating the presence of video.

metric.name: IsBackground
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for a background playback.

metric.name: IsEME
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an EME playback.

metric.name: IsMSE
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for an MSE playback. If false it means this was a SRC playback.

metric.name: IsMuted
metric.summary: Boolean value indicating if this event is for a muted playback.

metric.name: IsTopFrame
metric.summary: Flag indicating whether the report comes from the top frame or some inner frame. For privacy, metrics from inner frames are recorded with the top frame's origin, so this flag helps separate top frame vs. embedded playbacks.

metric.name: LastPipelineStatus
metric.summary: media::PipelineStatus enum value. Always 0 if the playback succeeded; all other values indicate the playback ended in an error.

metric.name: MeanTimeBetweenRebuffers
metric.summary: Average number of milliseconds between rebuffering events. Only reported if a rebuffering event occurred. Computed by dividing total watch time by the number of rebuffering events.

metric.name: PlayerID
metric.summary: ID which corresponds to a given WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. May be linked with Media.WebMediaPlayerState events to understand playback more deeply.

metric.name: RebuffersCount
metric.summary: Integer count of the number of times playback experienced rebuffering.

metric.name: VideoCodec
metric.summary: media::VideoCodec enum value. Can be kUnknownVideoCodec even with HasVideo is true because we don't always know the codec.

metric.name: VideoDecoderName
metric.summary: Enumeration of video decoder names, zero if none or unknown (Cast, HLS, etc). See WatchTimeRecorder::VideoDecoderName enum for expected values.

metric.name: VideoNaturalHeight
metric.summary: Integer value indicating the natural height of the playback.

metric.name: VideoNaturalWidth
metric.summary: Integer value indicating the natural width of the playback.

metric.name: WatchTime
metric.summary: Watch time in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics.

metric.name: WatchTime.AC
metric.summary: Watch time on AC power in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics.

metric.name: WatchTime.Battery
metric.summary: Watch time on battery power in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics.

metric.name: WatchTime.DisplayFullscreen
metric.summary: Watch time for fullscreen in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.DisplayInline
metric.summary: Watch time for inline display in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.DisplayPictureInPicture
metric.summary: Watch time for picture in picture display in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.NativeControlsOff
metric.summary: Watch time with no controls in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

metric.name: WatchTime.NativeControlsOn
metric.summary: Watch time with native controls in milliseconds for this playback. See Media.WatchTime UMA metrics. Only reported for foreground playbacks.

event.name: Media.VideoDecodePerfRecord
event.summary: A record of decoding performance metrics from a video playback with the given stream characteristics (profile, resolution, fps). Also includes what Media Capabilities API would claim for such a stream as a means of assessing the API's accuracy.

metric.name: Perf.ApiWouldClaimIsPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify streams with these characteristics as power efficient prior to considering this latest record. MediaCapabilities prediction is accurate when this value matches RecordIsPowerEfficient.

metric.name: Perf.ApiWouldClaimIsSmooth
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify streams with these characteristics as smooth prior to considering this latest record. MediaCapabilities prediction is accurate when this value matches RecordIsSmooth.

metric.name: Perf.PastVideoFramesDecoded
metric.summary: Integer count of past video frames decoded for the given video type.

metric.name: Perf.PastVideoFramesDropped
metric.summary: Integer count of past video frames dropped for the given video type.

metric.name: Perf.PastVideoFramesPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Integer count of past video frames power efficient for the given video type.

metric.name: Perf.RecordIsPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify this isolated playback record as power efficient.

metric.name: Perf.RecordIsSmooth
metric.summary: Boolean signaling whether MediaCapabilities would classify this isolated playback record as smooth.

metric.name: Perf.VideoFramesDecoded
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames decoded in this record.

metric.name: Perf.VideoFramesDropped
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames dropped in this record. Should not exceed VideoFramesDecoded.

metric.name: Perf.VideoFramesPowerEfficient
metric.summary: Integer count of the video frames decoded via power efficient means in this record. Should not exceed VideoFramesDecoded.

metric.name: Video.CodecProfile
metric.summary: media::VideoCodecProfile enum value. Can be VIDEO_CODEC_PROFILE_UNKNOWN if we don't know the audio codec.

metric.name: Video.FramesPerSecond
metric.summary: Integer representing video frames per second. This is the cadence of video frames as described by stream timestamps multiplied by HTMLMediaELement.playbackRate.

metric.name: Video.InTopFrame
metric.summary: Flag indicating whether the record comes from the top frame or some inner frame. For privacy, metrics from inner frames are recorded with the top frame's origin, so this flag helps separate top frame vs. embedded playbacks.

metric.name: Video.NaturalHeight
metric.summary: Integer representing height of video natural size.

metric.name: Video.NaturalWidth
metric.summary: Integer representing width of video natural size.

metric.name: Video.PlayerID
metric.summary: ID which corresponds to a given WebMediaPlayerImpl instance. May be linked with Media.WebMediaPlayerState events to understand playback more deeply.

event.name: Memory.Experimental
event.summary: Metrics associated with memory consumption, in MB.

metric.name: ArrayBuffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Array Buffer.

metric.name: BlinkGC
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Oilpan.

metric.name: BlinkGC.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by live allocations made from Oilpan.

metric.name: CommandBuffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by GL command buffer.

metric.name: Discardable
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Discardable memory service.

metric.name: DownloadService
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by download service.

metric.name: Extensions.ValueStore
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Key Value Store databases of extensions.

metric.name: FontCaches
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by font platform and shape caches in renderer process.

metric.name: History
metric.summary: Approximate measure of memory consumed by History service.

metric.name: IsVisible
metric.summary: Indicates whether the tab is visible or not at the time of metric collection.

metric.name: JavaHeap
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by java heap on Android.

metric.name: LevelDatabase
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by unaccounted level databases.

metric.name: Malloc
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by malloc, that is not classified by other metrics.

metric.name: Net
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by network sockets and caches.

metric.name: Net.UrlRequestContext
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by all network requests.

metric.name: NumberOfAdSubframes
metric.summary: The number of ad subframes that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfDetachedScriptStates
metric.summary: The number of detached ScriptState that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfDocuments
metric.summary: The number of documents that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfExtensions
metric.summary: The number of extensions that are served from the associated renderer process.

metric.name: NumberOfFrames
metric.summary: The number of frames that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfLayoutObjects
metric.summary: The number of layout objects that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: NumberOfMojoHandles
metric.summary: The number of mojo handles stored in HandleTable.

metric.name: NumberOfNodes
metric.summary: The number of nodes that the associated renderer owns.

metric.name: OmniboxSuggestions
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to URL indexing and autocomplete suggestions.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc
metric.summary: Measure of memory allocated by PartitionAlloc allocator.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.AllocatedObjects
metric.summary: Measure of total memory used by objects allocated using PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.ArrayBuffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Array Buffer partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.Buffer
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Buffer partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.FastMalloc
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Fast Malloc partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PartitionAlloc.Partitions.Layout
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Layout partition in PartitionAlloc.

metric.name: PrivateMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total private memory consumed by process.

metric.name: PrivateSwapFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of private swap memory consumed by a process. Available on Linux and Android.

metric.name: ProcessType
metric.summary: Type of process (e.g. browser, renderer, GPU --- see services/resource_coordinator/public/mojom/memory_instrumentation/memory_instrumentation.mojom) of associated metrics.

metric.name: Resident
metric.summary: Size of process' working set.

metric.name: SharedMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total shared memory consumed by process.

metric.name: SiteStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to web storage APIs in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.BlobStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by in-memory blob file API in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.IndexDB
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to IndexedDB API in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.LocalStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to Local Storage API in browser process.

metric.name: SiteStorage.SessionStorage
metric.summary: Measure of memory used due to Session Storage API in browser process.

metric.name: Skia
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Skia.

metric.name: Skia.SkGlyphCache
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Skia Glyph Cache.

metric.name: Skia.SkResourceCache
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Skia Resource Cache.

metric.name: Sqlite
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by all sqlite databases.

metric.name: Sync
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Sync storage.

metric.name: TabRestore
metric.summary: Approximate measure of memory used by Tab restore service.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastNavigation
metric.summary: The time in seconds since the Tab navigated. Only emitted for tabs that are not sharing a process.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastVisibilityChange
metric.summary: The time in seconds since the Tab changed visibility. Only emitted for tabs that are not sharing a process.

metric.name: Total2.PrivateMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total private memory consumed by all processes.

metric.name: Total2.SharedMemoryFootprint
metric.summary: Measure of total shared memory consumed by all processes.

metric.name: UI
metric.summary: Measure of memory used by Android UI bitmaps.

metric.name: Uptime
metric.summary: Process uptime.

metric.name: V8
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by V8.

metric.name: WebCache
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by all resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: WebCache.CSSStylesheetResources
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by CSS Stylesheet resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: WebCache.FontResources
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Font resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: WebCache.ImageResources
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Image resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: WebCache.OtherResources
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by other resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: WebCache.ScriptResources
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by Script resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: WebCache.XSLStylesheetResources
metric.summary: Measure of memory consumed by XSL Stylesheet resources in Blink Web Cache.

metric.name: RequestedFromForeground
metric.summary: Metrics that measure which URLs the user is requesting offline page copies of, and whether they were requested from the foreground or background UI. The value is 1 if requested from the foreground, 0 from background.

event.name: PageDomainInfo
event.summary: Metrics that describe the domain of pages that successfully commit. One event is generated per page load that commits. Currently associated with LocalNetworkRequests UKM metric collection.

metric.name: DomainType
metric.summary: An enum value representing the type of domain of the loaded page. The enum is defined in |LocalNetworkRequestsPageLoadMetricsObserver|. Possible values are 0 for unknown (should never be logged), 1 for pages with public domains, 2 for pages with private domains (IP addresses that are part of a reserved IP space not including localhost), or 4 for localhost.

event.name: PageLoad
event.summary: Core metrics associated with web page loads.

metric.name: DocumentTiming.NavigationToDOMContentLoadedEventFired
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the DOMContentLoaded event is fired, for main frame documents.

metric.name: DocumentTiming.NavigationToLoadEventFired
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the load event is fired, for main frame documents.

metric.name: Experimental.NavigationToInteractive
metric.summary: Measures Time to Interactive, a metric based on main thread and network heuristics to approximate the point in time when the page feels interactive to the user. See https://goo.gl/TFw6xz for detailed explanation. This histogram uses First Meaningful Paint as the lower bound for quiescent windows. The unit of time is ms.

metric.name: Experimental.PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstMeaningfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the first meaningful paint (http://bit.ly/ttfmp-doc), for main frame documents.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputDelay
metric.summary: Measures First Input Delay, the duration between the hardware timestamp and the start of event processing on the main thread for the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: InteractiveTiming.FirstInputTimestamp
metric.summary: The duration between navigation start and the hardware timestamp of the first meaningful input per navigation. See https://goo.gl/tr1oTZ for a detailed explanation. In ms.

metric.name: Navigation.PageTransition
metric.summary: The |ui::PageTransition| for the main frame navigation of this page load.

metric.name: Net.CacheBytes
metric.summary: The total number of body bytes loaded from cache for all resources on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3).

metric.name: Net.DownstreamKbpsEstimate.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The downstream throughput (in kilobits per second) for this page load, at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.EffectiveConnectionType.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The |net::EffectiveConnectionType| at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.EffectiveConnectionType2.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The |SystemProfileProto::Network::EffectiveConnectionType| at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.ErrorCode.OnFailedProvisionalLoad
metric.summary: The |net::Error| code for this page load. Only logged for failed provisional navigations.

metric.name: Net.HttpRttEstimate.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The HTTP round trip time estimate for this page load, at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: Net.NetworkBytes
metric.summary: The total number of body bytes loaded from the network for all resources on the page. This is rounded down to the nearest exponential bucket (with a bucket spacing factor of 1.3).

metric.name: Net.TransportRttEstimate.OnNavigationStart
metric.summary: The transport round trip time estimate for this page load, at the time the navigation for this page load was initiated.

metric.name: PageTiming.ForegroundDuration
metric.summary: For page loads that start in the foreground, measures the duration of time in milliseconds until one of the following events occurs: the load of the main resource fails, the page load is stopped, the tab hosting the page is closed, the render process hosting the page goes away, a new navigation which later commits is initiated in the same tab, or the tab hosting the page is backgrounded. This metric has a very long tail, for pages that spend a long period of time in the foreground. As such, use of the mean or tail values are not recommended.

metric.name: PageTiming.NavigationToFailedProvisionalLoad
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the provisional load failed. Only measures provisional loads that failed in the foreground.

metric.name: PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstContentfulPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time when the page first paints content. A contentful paint includes a paint of text, image, SVG, or canvas.

metric.name: PaintTiming.NavigationToFirstPaint
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the first paint is performed.

metric.name: ParseTiming.NavigationToParseStart
metric.summary: Measures the time in milliseconds from navigation timing's navigation start to the time the parser started, for main frame documents.

event.name: PageLoad.FromGoogleSearch
event.summary: Recorded for page loads that were navigated to via Google Search.

event.name: PageLoad.ServiceWorkerControlled
event.summary: Recorded for page loads controlled by a service worker.

event.name: PasswordForm
event.summary: Metrics about password forms on websites and the user's interactions with them. A separate event is generated for each password form discovered on a site.

metric.name: Context.FormSignature
metric.summary: Records a low entropy hash of the form signature in order to be able to distinguish two forms on the same site.

metric.name: ManagerFill.Action
metric.summary: Records for each password form (and HTTP auth), whether the password manager has filled/provided credentials. Recorded values correspond to the enum ManagerAutofillEvent.

metric.name: Saving.Prompt.Interaction
metric.summary: Records how the user interacted with a saving prompt. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleDismissalReason.

metric.name: Saving.Prompt.Shown
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether the user was shown a prompt that asked for permission to save new credentials. In case a store() via the Credential Management API, a virtual password form is created, for which this metric is recorded. Recorded values are 0 and 1 for false and true.

metric.name: Saving.Prompt.Trigger
metric.summary: Records the trigger of each password save bubble that was shown to the user to ask for permission to save new credentials. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleTrigger.

metric.name: Submission.Indicator
metric.summary: Records the event that led the password manager to believe the submission was successful. Metrics is recorded only when the password is saved. Recorded values correspond to the enum autofill::PasswordForm::SubmissionIndicatorEvent.

metric.name: Submission.Observed
metric.summary: Records whether a submission of a password form has been observered. The values 0 and 1 correspond to false and true respectively.

metric.name: Submission.SubmissionResult
metric.summary: Records the outcome of a password form submission. The values are numbered according to PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::SubmitResult. Note that no metric is recorded for kSubmitResultNotSubmitted.

metric.name: Submission.SubmittedFormType
metric.summary: Records the classification of a form at submission time. The values correspond to PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::SubmittedFormType. Note that no metric is recorded for kSubmittedFormTypeUnspecified.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Generated.HTTPSNotHTTP
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were stored for an HTTPS origin while the password form was seen on an HTTP origin. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally auto-generated (as opposed to user typed). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Generated.PSLMatching
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only PSL-matching the origin of the observed form (see the suffix description for the possible classes of such near-matches). If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally auto-generated (as opposed to user typed). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Generated.SameOrganizationName
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only matching the visited origin if the TLD is stripped. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally auto-generated (as opposed to user typed). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Manual.HTTPSNotHTTP
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were stored for an HTTPS origin while the password form was seen on an HTTP origin. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally entered by the user (as opposed to auto-generated). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Manual.PSLMatching
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only PSL-matching the origin of the observed form (see the suffix description for the possible classes of such near-matches). If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally entered by the user (as opposed to auto-generated). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: SuppressedAccount.Manual.SameOrganizationName
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether there were `suppressed` credentials, meaning stored credentials that were not filled, that were suppressed because they were for an origin that was only matching the visited origin if the TLD is stripped. If there were such credentials, the histogram also records whether the username and password of such suppressed credentials matched those submitted. This recording happens only for credentials that were originally entered by the user (as opposed to auto-generated). Recorded values correspond to the enum SuppressedAccountExistence.

metric.name: Updating.Prompt.Interaction
metric.summary: Records how the user interacted with an updating prompt. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleDismissalReason.

metric.name: Updating.Prompt.Shown
metric.summary: Records, for each password form seen by the password manager, whether the user was shown a prompt that asked for permission to update existing credentials. Recorded values are 0 and 1 for false and true.

metric.name: Updating.Prompt.Trigger
metric.summary: Records the trigger of each password update bubble that was shown to the user to ask for permission to update existing credentials. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::BubbleTrigger.

metric.name: User.Action
metric.obsolete: Deprecated. Use new user actions ("User.Action....") instead.
metric.summary: Records what the user does with all UI entry points of the password manager UI, like bubbles, context menus, forms, form fields, etc. in relation to a given form. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordFormMetricsRecorder::DetailedUserAction. In contrast to User.ActionSimplified, this metric is intended to be extended over time.

metric.name: User.Action.CorrectedUsernameInForm
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user corrected a username in a password form. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.EditedUsernameInBubble
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user edited a username in a password save/update bubble. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.SelectedDifferentPasswordInBubble
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user selected a different password in a save/update bubble. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.TriggeredManualFallbackForSaving
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user triggered the manual fallback for password saving. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.Action.TriggeredManualFallbackForUpdating
metric.summary: Counts how many times the user triggered the manual fallback for password updating. This is only populated if events happened.

metric.name: User.ActionSimplified
metric.summary: Records what the user does with a form. Recorded values correspond to the enum password_manager::UserAction.

event.name: PageWithPassword
event.summary: Metrics about websites that contain password forms and the user's interactions with them. No events are created for pages that don't contain password forms.

metric.name: PageLevelUserAction
metric.summary: Records if the user interacts with the password manager in a way that cannot (reliably) be attributed to a specific PasswordFormManager. Values correspond to the enum PasswordManagerMetricsRecorder::PageLevelUserAction.

metric.name: ProvisionalSaveFailure
metric.summary: Records a provisional save failure in case the password manager cannot offer to save a credential. Recorded values correspond to the enum PasswordManagerMetricsRecorder::ProvisionalSaveFailure.

metric.name: UserModifiedPasswordField
metric.summary: Records a 1 for every page on which a user has modified a password text field - regardless of how many password fields a page contains or the user modifies.

metric.name: CompletionStatus
metric.summary: How the Payment Request ended. Values defined in the CompletionStatus enum of components/payments/core/journey_logger.h.

metric.name: Events
metric.summary: Bitfield representing the events that occurred during the Payment Request. Values defined in the Event enum of components/payments/core/journey_logger.h.

event.name: Permission
event.summary: Metrics for when a user's permission actions. Currently we only log when a permission prompt is resolved. Grouped (microphone+camera) permission prompts are reported separately.

metric.name: Action
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionAction. One of GRANTED, DENIED, DISMISSED or IGNORED.

metric.name: Gesture
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionRequestGestureType, whether the prompt was initiated by a user gesture.

metric.name: PermissionType
metric.summary: An enum of type ContentSettingsType.

metric.name: PriorDismissals
metric.summary: The number of dismissed prompts for the given (origin, permission) pair, capped at 10 dismissals.

metric.name: PriorIgnores
metric.summary: The number of ignored prompts for the given (origin, permission) pair, capped at 10 ignores.

metric.name: Source
metric.summary: An enum of type PermissionSourceUI. The UI surface for this action. Currently we only record when this is PROMPT.

event.name: Plugins.FlashInstance
event.summary: Recorded when a Flash object instance is created.

event.name: Previews
event.summary: Previews related metrics associated with a page load. See //componenets/previews/.

metric.name: client_lofi
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a client lo-fi image in a page load.

metric.name: lite_page
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a lite page in page load.

metric.name: noscript
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a NoScript preview on a page load.

metric.name: opt_out
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user clicks "Show Original" on a preview page load.

metric.name: origin_opt_out
metric.summary: Set to 1 when previews were enabled but no preview was attempted because the origin provided a Cache-Control:no-transform header in the main frame response. This is a directive from the origin to not perform any transformation so in the context of the Previews feature, it is an opt-out by the origin site (rather than the user).

metric.name: save_data_enabled
metric.summary: Set to 1 if the data saver feature was enabled in Chrome at the time of the page commit.

metric.name: server_lofi
metric.summary: Set to 1 when a user is shown a server lo-fi image in a page load.

event.name: ResponsivenessMeasurement
event.summary: Responsiveness metrics recorded once every 5 seconds.

metric.name: ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration
metric.summary: Duration in MS for expected task queueing duration. The metric reflects the responsiveness of a tab. A lower value means the tab will respond to inputs faster. This metric is equal to RendererScheduler.ExpectedTaskQueueingDuration of the main frame process.

event.name: RendererSchedulerTask
event.summary: Sampled task from the renderer main thread. Sample rate is controlled dynamically. See blink::scheduler::MainThreadSchedulerImpl::ShouldRecordTaskUkm.

metric.name: FrameStatus
metric.summary: Frame status of the frame associated with the context of this task. See blink::scheduler::FrameStatus for the values of this enum.

metric.name: PageSchedulers
metric.summary: Number of pages this task should be attributed to. One if there is a hard attribution, number of pages in the process otherwise.

metric.name: QueueType
metric.summary: Type of the task queue which this task was posted to. See blink::scheduler::MainThreadTaskQueue::TaskType for the values of this enum.

metric.name: RendererAudible
metric.summary: Whether renderer was playing audio when this task was run. Boolean, encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: RendererBackgrounded
metric.summary: Whether renderer was backgrounded when this task was run. Boolean, encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: RendererHidden
metric.summary: Whether renderer was hidden when this task was run. Boolean, encoded as an integer (0/1).

metric.name: TaskCPUDuration
metric.summary: CPU duration of this task in microseconds.

metric.name: TaskDuration
metric.summary: Duration of this task in microseconds.

metric.name: TaskType
metric.summary: blink::TaskType for the current task.

metric.name: UseCase
metric.summary: MainThreadSchedulerImpl's UseCase when this task was run. See blink::scheduler::UseCase for the values of this enum.

event.name: Pepper.Broker
event.summary: Event recorded when a flash instance connects to the broker, resulting in a channel being opened to the broker process.

event.name: Popup.Closed
event.summary: A popup window was closed.

metric.name: EngagementTime
metric.summary: The time (in ms, rounded down to the nearest power of 2) a popup WebContents is visible / foregrounded, until it is closed. Keyed by the popup opener's URL (not the URL of the popup).

metric.name: UserInitiatedClose
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the popup was closed by user gesture.

event.name: ScreenBrightness
event.summary: Collects metrics periodically and on screen brightness change.

metric.name: BatteryPercent
metric.summary: Percentage of battery, rounded down to a multiple of 5%, i.e. [0, 5%) is mapped to 0, [5%, 10%) is mapped to 5 etc.

metric.name: Brightness
metric.summary: Screen percentage brightness. between 0 and 100.

metric.name: DayOfWeek
metric.summary: An enum representing the of the week that the data was logged, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::ScreenBrightness::Features::ActivityData:: DayOfWeek|.

metric.name: DeviceMode
metric.summary: An enum representing the mode of the device, defined in |chromeos::power::ml::ScreenBrightness::Feature::EnvData:DeviceMode|

metric.name: HourOfDay
metric.summary: The hour of the day when the data is logged. Hours since midnight in the local time zone.

metric.name: IsAutoclickEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the auto click is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsBrailleDisplayConnected
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the braille display is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsCaretHighlightEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the caret highlight is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsCursorHighlightEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the cursor highlight is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsFocusHighlightEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the focus highlight is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsHighContrastEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the high contrast is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsLargeCursorEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the large cursor is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsMagnifierEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the full screen magnifier is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsMonoAudioEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the mono audio is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsSelectToSpeakEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether select to speak is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsSpokenFeedbackEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the spoken feedback is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsSwitchAccessEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether switch access is currently enabled.

metric.name: IsVideoPlaying
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether video is currently playing.

metric.name: IsVirtualKeyboardEnabled
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the virtual keyboard is currently enabled.

metric.name: LastActivityTimeSec
metric.summary: Time between the last activity and when the data was logged. A duration timestamp in seconds.

metric.name: NightLightTemperaturePercent
metric.summary: The temperature percentage of night light screen color adjustment when night light is on. Ranges from 0 to 100.

metric.name: NumRecentKeyEvents
metric.summary: The number of keyboard events in the last hour.

metric.name: NumRecentMouseEvents
metric.summary: The number of mouse events in the last hour.

metric.name: NumRecentStylusEvents
metric.summary: The number of stylus events in the last hour.

metric.name: NumRecentTouchEvents
metric.summary: The number of touch events in the last hour.

metric.name: OnBattery
metric.summary: Boolean value to represent whether the device is currently on battery power.

metric.name: PreviousBrightness
metric.summary: The brightness of the screen prior to the time at which the current event was logged.

metric.name: Reason
metric.summary: The reason that the event is logged. Values are enumerated in |chromeos::power::ml::ScreenBrightness::Event::Reason|.

metric.name: RecentTimeActiveSec
metric.summary: How long the user has been active. A duration timestamp in seconds.

metric.name: SequenceId
metric.summary: The ID of this event in the current session.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastEventSec
metric.summary: Time in seconds since last time an event was logged.

event.name: Security.SiteEngagement
event.summary: Site engagement score behavior for a page with a given Security Level.

metric.name: FinalSecurityLevel
metric.summary: The final SecurityLevel of the page before it is closed or another navigation occurs. Based on the enum security_state::SecurityLevel.

metric.name: InitialSecurityLevel
metric.summary: The initial SecurityLevel of the page when the navigation commits. Based on the enum security_state::SecurityLevel.

metric.name: ScoreDelta
metric.summary: The change in Site Engagement score for the page before it is closed or another navigation occurs compared to the score from when the navigation committed. Score is between 0.0 and 100.0; delta is between -100.0 and 100.0. Rounded to the nearest integer.

metric.name: ScoreFinal
metric.summary: The final Site Engagement score for the page before it is closed or another navigation occurs. Score is between 0.0 and 100.0; this metric is rounded down to a multiple of 10 to limit granularity.

event.name: SiteIsolation.XSD.Browser.Blocked
event.summary: Resource request response was blocked by the cross-site document blocking logic in the browser process.

metric.name: CanonicalMimeType
metric.summary: Classification of the Content-Type HTTP response header into one of the blockable document flavours: html, xml, json, plain.

metric.name: ContentLengthWasZero
metric.summary: ContentLengthWasZero=1 if Content-Length was available and equal to 0. ContentLengthWasZero=0 otherwise.

metric.name: ContentResourceType
metric.summary: content::ResourceType of the blocked resource (e.g. image / script / xhr / etc.).

metric.name: HttpResponseCode
metric.summary: The HTTP response code (e.g. 200 or 404) associated with the blocked resource request.

metric.name: NeededSniffing
metric.summary: Whether the HTTP response needed sniffing to confirm its MIME type.

event.name: SubresourceFilter
event.summary: Recorded for page loads where subresource filtering policy was evaluated.

metric.name: ActivationDecision
metric.summary: Enum that records the policy decision to activate subresource filtering for a page load. 0 = Unknown, 1 = Activated, 2 = Disabled, 3 = Deprecated value, 4 = URL whitelisted, 5 = Activation conditions not met. 'Activated' indicates that subresource filtering was activated. All other reasons indicate that subresource filtering was not activated.

metric.name: DryRun
metric.summary: Records '1' if subresource filtering was activated in dry run mode. In dry run mode, subresource filtering policy is evaluated against resources loaded on the page, but subresource filtering is not actually applied.

event.name: Tab.RendererOOM
event.summary: Metrics about renderer OOM, recorded for each detected OOM of renderer process.

metric.name: TimeSinceLastNavigation
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the main frame navigation was triggered to when the tab crashed with OOM. Recorded only on Windows, Android and Chrome OS. We do not have a way to detect OOMs reliably on Linux and Mac.

event.name: Translate
event.summary: Metrics related to a Translate event. These metrics are described in TranslateEventProto.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstAlertFired
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when a JavaScript alert is fired. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Indicates whether the alert is fired from main frame.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when alert is fired.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstAudioStarts
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when audio starts to play. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.

metric.name: IsMainFrame
metric.summary: Indicates whether the audio stream belongs to the main frame.

metric.name: TimeFromBackgrounded
metric.summary: Duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when audio starts to play.

event.name: TabManager.Background.FirstFaviconUpdated
event.summary: Collects the duration in MS from when the tab is backgrounded to when the favicon is updated. Only recorded when the tab is in the background.
